subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Hindu Temples: Where Heaven Meets Earth
description: A short lesson to help you apply Hindu Temples: Where Heaven Meets Earth.

hook.text: A Hindu temple is not a building. It is the body of God. Every wall, tower, and statue maps the cosmos in stone.

buildup.text: Temple architecture follows sacred geometry. The innermost shrine represents the divine center of the universe.

discovery.text: Worshippers move from the outer chaos to the inner stillness. The temple journey mirrors the spiritual journey inward.

twist.text: Some temples like Angkor Wat in Cambodia were built by Hindu kings outside India, proving the faith's vast reach.

climax.text: Hindu temples are living spaces. Gods are bathed, fed, and put to sleep daily. The sacred is active, not abstract.

punchline.text: Hindu temples are the body of God. Every visit is a journey inward.

quiz.question: What does a Hindu temple represent?
options: The body of God and a map of the cosmos
